content.description: A fun little cruiser to check out when the Boy Scout Wall is swamped. Solid rock, easy clipping positions, and a small crux at the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a double rappel ring anchor station.
content.location: The obvious route that moves left to right on the Rhino Wall.

content.description: This route begins with a fun boulder problem. Look for the obvious side pull start on the wall and bust a move to the blocky jug directly above; of course there are intermediates along the way. Clip the first bolt and begin the traverse ascent towards 2 more bolts across the arete. Then clip your fourth bolt and climb out of the arete towards the finishing slab and the fifth bolt (shared with Fully CHARGED!). Finish at the anchors above. *If top roping this route either follow and unclip/clean or place a directional at the 3rd bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a rap ring anchor station. Shares the fifth bolt and anchor with Fully Charged*
content.location: The middle of the 3 routes on Rhino Wall.

content.description: This route starts just to the right of "Rhino's Revenge". Easy climbing through the first few bolts leads to an easy crux between the 3rd and 4th bolts. Clip the 4th bolt which is in the obvious large depression in the rock (it is a few feet or so to the right of the 4th bolt on the neighboring route). Climb onto the ramp towards the fifth bolt (shared with Rhino's Revenge) and finishing slab and anchor. *This route is shaded most of the day and has really good rock quality throughout.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a rap ring anchor. Shares the fifth bolt and anchor with Rhino's Revenge.
content.location: The route farthest right on the Rhino Wall.
